document_data.name: Zima al-Hatik
document_data.mainbody: '''Zima al-Hatik''' was a [[sage]] who lived in [[Huzuz]] in [[1367 DR]].{{AQ-time}}{{cite book/City of Delights/Gem of Zakhara|55-56}}
document_data.Description: Zima was a cranky old man.
document_data.Activities:
Zima was the proprietor of a rare book shop. Though he only made one appointment per night, he would meet with anyone at anytime if they had a rare book to sell.

He charged 10 [[dinar]] for an appointment. The steep price helped eliminate foolish customers wasting his precious time.
document_data.Possessions: Zima owned a pair of magical spectacles that he acquired from a [[Lantan]] merchant. The spectacles allowed him to glance at any page of a book and instantly commit it to memory. These wondrous spectacles gave Zima a degree of specialization in a huge variety of sage topics.
